intro: Allium pallens subsp. coppoleri, commonly known as the Corsican leek, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring basal leaves that are narrow and grass-like. The plant produces umbels of white to pale purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its bulbs are small and are often used in local cuisines for their mild, onion-like flavor. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade.
